title: TV best bets: Thur., Oct. 15
text:
TV best bets: Thur., Oct. 15 October 15, 2015 Last updated: Thursday, October 15, 2015, 1:20 AM The Record Print 
8 p.m., NBC: Heroes Reborn — Miko’s (Kiki Sukezane) determination to reclaim her sword portends big trouble for her in the new episode "The Lion’s Den." Noah and Quentin (Jack Coleman and Henry Zebrowski) form a team against evil. Tommy (Robbie Kay) finds himself in a tight spot. Luke (Zachary Levi) has to deal with his past. Carlos (Ryan Guzman) gets a possible comrade. Buy this photo Kiki Sukezane stars in "Heroes Reborn," 8 p.m., NBC. 
9 p.m., FOX: Sleepy Hollow — Pandora (Shannyn Sossamon) unleashes part of her legendary box in the new episode "Blood and Fear." One of the items from it is transformative, literally, since it conveys humans from their regular form into horrifying beings, and Ichabod and Abbie (Tom Mison, Nicole Beharie) set out to stop her as she preys upon the residents of Sleepy Hollow. 
10 p.m., SYFY CHANNEL: Haven — It’s up to Dwight and Charlotte (Adam Copeland and Laura Mennell) to clear Nathan’s (Lucas Bryant) name when the townspeople of Haven put him on trial for his life. The Teagues brothers try to buy time by moderating the trial, while Audrey (Emily Rose) continues to search for a solution to the darkness problem in the new episode "The Trial of Nathan Wuornos." 
11:03 p.m., HISTORY CHANNEL: Power & Ice — In the season finale, a new episode called "Down for the Count," the Alaska Line Builders team rushes to finish their work in Tuntutuliak, while Electric Power Constructors tackles its riskiest gig yet as its workers end a very successful winter season. Bam Bam from City Electric hopes to return to his job following his neck injury, only to receive some shocking news. © 2015 North Jersey Media Group Tags:
